name: Holiday Inn Express Girona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The desk staff are very friendly and helpful - except when the fire alarm goes off at 00:15. Seriously though the bigest problem we had was the very large numbers of school kides there on the weekend,which meant that breakfast was chaos.
reviews.title: Handy for motorway and for fashion shopping

reviews.text: This is a new hotel on the southern outskirts of Girona, about 15 minutes from the airport , 10 minutes into the town centre and with a big shopping centre directly opposite.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay
A good address in Girona.
reviews.text: The multilingual staff were extremely pleasant and made our check-in easy and swift.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are freshly decorated, perfectly clean and comfortable . We were travelling as a family of 2 adults+ 2 kids aged 14 and 6, and there was ample space in our room for a short stay ( 2 nights initially then a final night before flying home). My only quibble would be that there was some corridor noise in the morning ( Why do people let their doors slam shut when they know they are not alone in a hotel ?!) . While the airport is close, the noise from planes is only noticeable when the window is open.
reviews.title: Simple and Ordinary

reviews.text: Complimentary breakfast in the morning was perfectly adequate , and served in an open plan area off the entrance lobby.
reviews.title: Great hotel! Girona is a wonderful city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To sum up, then, this is a very good option if you don't want to be in the heart of Girona. Parking is free, and there is easy access to the surrounding region, whether it be on the Costa Brava , the lovely inland villages, or simply to the main motorway if you're heading north or south. I would stay here again, especially at the price we paid (approx. 70 Euros on average a night).
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: These apartments are linked to the Hotel Historic, which is one street higher. There are aprtments next door to the hotel, which are very nice, and these are the overspill ones. We changed our holiday dates and so they moved us into these apartments.
reviews.title: Too hot for the summer

likes.liked: — Set in the old town up steep steps, not good for less abled people, no air con.

reviews.text: I stayed here on a short break. The hotel is quite far from central Gerona but buses are regular and only take about 20 minutes. It is a brand-new building (February 2008), conveniently situated next to a huge shopping complex. The staff were consistently helpful and a generous buffet breakfast is included in the price. The room, even for a solo traveller, was very spacious and comfortable. Its only drawbacks (for me) were that there was no minibar and the TV channels, so far as I could tell, were all in Castilian (which I don't mind) or Catalan. In general, I found the hotel very pleasant.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel in a delightful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Girona itself is a delightful city - perhaps the nicest I've yet visited in Spain. It is small and compact but has a labyrinthine old town, with several places of great interest. Wandering along the 'Archaeological Walkway' is rather like entering a dreamworld, which also throws light on Gerona's history.
reviews.title: Great stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Ideal for airport and visiting Girona

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn, as we were late into Girona, whilst on our way to France.
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.text: after reading reviews here. Everything was as described. Great little hotel, very clean, lovely room for one night. I don't feel I would stay here for a holiday, but if you want to see Girona for a weekend it is fine. The mall was good to visit next door, and there are lots of restaurants to choose from. Breakfast was good, Staff were very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: great value, comfortable and convenient

aka: Holiday Inn Express Girona Hotel Salt
description: Welcome to the Hotel Holiday Inn Express Girona , the hotel between the Pyrennees & the Costa Brava. A privileged location in the perimeter of the commercial centre 'Espai Girones', with an easy access from freeway AP7 (exit 7), turns it to an ideal base for business or leisure travellers. The Hotel Holiday Inn Express Girona its only 3 km from Girona centre (bus stop to the city near the hotel), and only few minutes from Girona s Airport. The Hotel is surrounded by the Girona s Exhibition & Fair centre,Salt Theatre and the Concert Hall 'La Mirona' where most international events take places. The commercial centre 'Espai Girones' offers to our guests a great selection of stores and leisure activities. 93 modern rooms with television via satellite (flat screen) high speed internet connection, WIFI connectivity in the meeting room and public area. Handicapped rooms available and a free on-site outdoor parking is available for our guests. One Meeting Room, with daylight, up to 25 people, our Family policy allows the accommodation of two adults plus two children (using sofa bed with no extra cost)All rooms rate include a complimentary Continental breakfast (buffet). After an intense day, the hotel s bar offers an ideal atmosphere to relax and enjoy your favourite drink.We look forward to welcoming you at the Holiday Inn Express Girona Hotel!
